001/*

004 * See LICENSE for details.

006
007package renderer.scene.primitives;
008
009/**
010   A {@code TriangleFan} object has {@code n+2} integers that
011   represent the vertices of {@code n} triangles that radiate
012   from a central point and another {@code n+1} integers that
013   represent the {@link java.awt.Color} at each of those vertices.
014<p>
015   The integers are indices into the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} and
016   {@link java.awt.Color} lists of a {@link renderer.scene.Model} object.
017<p>
018   See
019     <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Triangle_fan" target="_top">
020              https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Triangle_fan</a>
021*/
022public class TriangleFan extends OrientablePrimitive
023{
024   /**
025      Construct a {@code TriangleFan} with the given array of indices for
026      the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} and {@link java.awt.Color} index lists.
027      <p>
028      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
029      or {@link java.awt.Color} objects into this {@link Primitive}'s
030      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This constructor assumes that
031      the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this
032      {@link Primitive} gets rendered).
033
034      @param indices  array of vertex and color indices to place in this {@code TriangleFan}
035   */
036   public TriangleFan(final int... indices)
037   {
038      super(indices);
039   }
040
041
042   /**
043      Give the triangles of this {@code TriangleFan} the back face colors
044      indexed by the given color indices. The first color is for the center
045      of the triangle fan. The other two colors will alternate around the
046      periphery of the triangle fan.
047      <p>
048      NOTE: This method does not put any {@link java.awt.Color} objects
049      into this {@code TriangleFan}'s {@link renderer.scene.Model}
050      object. This method assumes that the given indices is valid (or will
051      be valid by the time this {@code TriangleFan} gets rendered).
052
053      @param c0  integer back face color index for this {@code TriangleFan}
054      @param c1  integer back face color index for this {@code TriangleFan}
055      @param c2  integer back face color index for this {@code TriangleFan}
056   */
057   public void setBackFaceColorIndex(int c0, int c1, int c2)
058   {
059      cIndexList2.set(0, c0);
060
061      final int[] c = {c2, c1};
062      for (int i = 1; i < cIndexList2.size(); ++i)
063      {
064         cIndexList2.set(i, c[i % 2]);
065      }
066   }
067
068
069   /**
070      For debugging.
071
072      @return {@link String} representation of this {@code TriangleFan} object
073   */
074   @Override
075   public String toString()
076   {
077      String result =  "TriangleFan: ([";
078      for (int i = 0; i < vIndexList.size() - 1; ++i)
079      {
080         result += vIndexList.get(i) + ", ";
081      }
082      result += vIndexList.get(vIndexList.size() - 1) + "], [";
083      for (int i = 0; i < cIndexList.size() - 1; ++i)
084      {
085         result += cIndexList.get(i) + ", ";
086      }
087      result += cIndexList.get(cIndexList.size() - 1) + "], [";
088      for (int i = 0; i < cIndexList2.size() - 1; ++i)
089      {
090         result += cIndexList2.get(i) + ", ";
091      }
092      result += cIndexList2.get(cIndexList2.size() - 1) + "])";
093      return result;
094   }
095}
